paper_abstract: We give a polynomial time randomized algorithm that, on receiving as input a pair (H, G) of n-vertex graphs, searches for an embedding of H into G. If H has bounded maximum degree and G is suitably dense and pseudorandom, then the algorithm succeeds with high probability. Our algorithm proves that, for every integer d3 and a large enough constant C = C-d, as n, asymptotically almost all graphs with n vertices and at least Cn2-1/dlog1/dn edges contain as subgraphs all graphs with n vertices and maximum degree at most d. (c) 2014 Wiley Periodicals, Inc. Random Struct. Alg., 2014
paper_title: An Improved Upper Bound on the Density of Universal Random Graphs
